page.title: 17BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: 0374/0116 is three-quarters pasture, one quarter arable.It includes a small managed patch of woodland.The land has breeding and milking cattle and yields cereals,mainly cattle fodder,hay and silage.A small amount of timber is cropped from the woodland.A resident population of thirty-two includes six retired people and one child.There is a working majority of eleven,mainly in agriculture but including workers in journalism and teaching.They live in nine houses with gardens and open outlooks towards rolling open country. The area is served by excellent public transport,approximately thirty outward journeys weekly.There are many amenities in the neighbouring villages of Marnhull and Stalbridge including shops schools and surgeries. A tributary of the Stour crosses the NW corner.
